jinngine.physics
Class Body

java.lang.Object
  jinngine_t.physics.Body

public final class Body
extends java.lang.Object

A body is a rigid body entity, that is animated according to the laws of Newton. A body can have one or more geometry instances attached, and these define its final mass and inertia properties.

Body

public Body(java.lang.String identifier,
            Geometry g)
Create a new Body with a single geometry instance. finalize() is called at the end of this constructor.

Parameters:
identifier - Unique identifier for this body
g - A geometry that will define this body's mass and inertia properties

Body

public Body(java.lang.String identifier,
            java.util.Iterator<Geometry> i)
Create a body using the given geometries. After adding all geometries in the iterator i has been added, finalize() is automatically called.

Parameters:
identifier - Unique identifier for this body
i -
Method Detail

addGeometry

public void addGeometry(Geometry g)
Add a geometry to this body

finalize

public final void finalize()
Calculate total mass and inertia matrix. Aligns all attached geometries to the centre off mass. This method must be called when all geometries are attached to this body. If any geometry changes its local position, orientation, mass, or inertia properties, this method must be called again to reflect those changes in the Body state. Some of the constructors call finalize() automatically.

Overrides:
finalize in class java.lang.Object
